thread.title: Boeing faces new petition for union at South Carolina plant

title: Boeing faces new petition for union at South Carolina plant

organizations.name: international association of machinists and aerospace workers

text: March 5, 2018 / 9:11 PM / in 23 minutes Boeing faces new petition for union at South Carolina plant Reuters Staff 2 Min Read (Reuters) - Boeing ( BA.N ) workers at an aircraft factory in South Carolina are seeking union representation, the company said on Monday, about one year after the planemaker defeated a high-profile union drive at the plant. File Picture: Construction cranes and palm trees line the entrance at South Carolina Boeing in North Charleston, South Carolina December 19, 2013. REUTERS/Randall Hill Boeing said it was the third petition in less than three years filed by the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM) seeking to unionise workers at the plant located in a strongly anti-union state. The IAM petition also comes a few months after the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) made it tougher for workers to form unions made up of small groups of employees, reversing an Obama-era decision that had been sharply criticized by businesses. “The company will challenge this filing because we strongly believe that the IAM’s attempt to isolate our flight line teammates is unreasonable and is prohibited by federal law,” said Joan Robinson-Berry, vice president and general manager of Boeing South Carolina. No election for union representation will be scheduled until the NLRB resolves the legal challenge, the Chicago-based company said. Last year, almost three-quarters of workers at the South Carolina plant who voted rejected union representation in a win for Boeing, which had launched an aggressive campaign against the IAM. The IAM did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Reporting by Arunima Banerjee in Bengaluru; Editing by Sai Sachin Ravikumar
